TopicTitle: 1.0.2 engine parameters at different atmospheric pressure values

Articles.Content:
IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve made an empirical research landing a large cargo bay full of rocket engines on Eve at different altitudes and measuring Isp.

> 
> [![pXnkyPY.png](http://i.imgur.com/pXnkyPY.png)](http://imgur.com/pXnkyPY)
> 
> ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
> 
> 

[Here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1AP8qOcUNIcaVEPBNfFurWLTlQIlKexzT-yoJDHM_VsE/edit?usp=sharing) are my results. ([A separate table](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1AkNzyzFV1prlvajccAgf6MA6xJPdIDmKFvwqVXxMraA/edit?usp=sharing) on the ion engine at low pressure values.)

These data are not quite precise though. It would be better to get the true values out of the cfg files.

What is the correct interpolation formula for the Isp curve?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-26T03:32:57Z" title="05/26/2015 03:32  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 26, 2015</time> by Teilnehmer**
[Cubic Hermite polynomials. Mind that KSP automagically picks some interesting slopes.](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/121239-Thrust-Isp-curve-calcuations)

Cool data. The engines with the highest ratio of thrust at 5 atm over their thrust at 1 atm were:

    Mammoth         0.67Aerospike       0.64Twin-Boar       0.53Mainsail        0.52Thud            0.51Rapier          0.51

So these should be the first places to look for Eve first stage ascent engines.
